result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas W. Krahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $13,410 plus surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas W. Krahn

records.addlTxt: Terminated on 6/9/17
from Agent McConville
Defts probation is extended for 1 yr from current discharge date or until all court obligations are completed.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Frank Parise. P&P Agent M. McConville present in court.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1044 -   Victim rights compliance. Agent McConville filed a petition for entry of civil judgment for unpaid restitution. ST presents motion for extension - no good faith effort made to pay. Atty Parise opposes motion. Discussion held. Court finds no good faith effort has been made to pay restitution. Probation is ordered extended for a period of 1 year. If restitution is paid off early, parties may bring case back for discharge. Petition for Civil Judgment shall be converted to Petition to Extend - signed this day.
Probation review hearing on June 6, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Due to ongoing JT, PRH rescheduled to 6/6/17 @ 10:45am. Attys confirm by email.
Probation review hearing on May 23, 2017 at 10:15 am.
to Request Probation Review Hearing filed by ADA Burgoyne

records.addlTxt: Amended Notice and Motion for Restitution Order
in the amount of $13,410.00
File sent to Br 7 for Judge's signature on restitution order
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Frank Parise.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  832 - Matter is resolved. DE enters plea of guilty as to Ct2 - found guilty by the court. Ct1 dismissed and read-in. Sentence recommendations. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court orders a $500 fine plus costs, due over term of probation. Parties stipulate to $13,410 in restitution.  Appeal rights given. (ps 6/14/16)
NO RECORD MADE. FPT adjourned prior to hearing by attorneys.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Frank Parise.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  936 -   Victim rights compliance.  DE requests another FPT for a possible resolution - granted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Case rescheduled prior to hearing. All parties confirm in person.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.
